thread.title: Breaking - Two savage dogs on loose after mum mauled outside primary school in vicious attack
thread.title_full: Breaking - Two savage dogs on loose after mum mauled outside primary school in vicious attack

author: Scarlet Howes
title: Breaking - Two savage dogs on loose after mum mauled outside primary school in vicious attack
text:
A mum has been attacked by dogs this afternoon (Photo: Giorgia Byrne/Facebook) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
A mum was brutally attacked by two Staffordshire Bull Terriers outside a school this afternoon. 
The dogs are reportedly still on the loose without an owner. 
The savage attack took place outside Hopping Hill primary school in Duston, Northampton. 
Daughter Georgia Byrne, 20, posted a photo of her mum's injuries to a public Facebook group in a bid to warn parents picking up children outside of the school about the 'dangerous' dogs. 
The school issued a warning online to parents picking up their children: "We are aware that 2 dogs are loose in Duston. 
"The school premises are secure. Please be vigilant when collecting tonight." 
We'll be bringing you the very latest updates, pictures and video on this breaking news story. 
For the latest news and breaking news visit Mirror.co.uk/news .
